732034f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island.
732034f-a.text:
A panoramic view of Governor's Island, as seen from the south of Brooklyn. Bedloe's Island is also seen in the center background.
About 1860.7

732035f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Upper New York Bay.]
732035f-a.text:
Governor's Island (center background) in the Upper New York Bay, as viewed southward on the East River from Brooklyn Bridge. On the right appear piers at the tip of Manhattan.
About 1886.
J. Koehler.

732036f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Castle William.]
732036f-a.text:
Governors Island: "Castle William" photographed
from the Upper Bay.
About 1890
Langill, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection

732065f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - Fort Jay.
732065f-a.text:
The grim battlements of Fort Jay (built in 1812), upon Governor's Island, stand ready to defend New York Bay and the metropolitan area. Manhattan's southern tip is to the north.
1925.
Wurts Brothers.

732073f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Polo field.]
732073f-a.text:
Governors Island: Several airplanes flying over the polo field
stands.
About 1930.

(3)

P. L. Sperr.

View 2: August 2, 1939

732055f-b.title: Islands - Governors Island - Bird's-eye-view.
732055f-b.text:
(1)
Bird's eye view of Governor's Island, seen from the roof of Brown Brothers, at Wall and Hanover Streets; during a hazy day.
June 26, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Wintry scene of Governor's Island and harbor, as seen from atop
No. 60 Wall Street, five years later.
February 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same view, several days later, showing the huge ice floes
surrounding Governor's Island.
February 9, 1934.
P.  L. Sperr.

732050f-c.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Upper New York Bay - New York Dock Co.; Standish Arms Hotel.]
732050f-c.text:
Governors Island: A set of 3 views photographed from atop the Hotel St. George in Brooklyn showing Butter-milk Channel separating the above mentioned Island from the Brooklyn mainland. Generally speaking this is more or less included in the Upper New York Bay.

Note beyond the Statue of Liberty on Bedloes Island, the Bayonne, New Jersey shoreline. The photographer is viewing eastward and has eliminated lower Manhattan, which if shown would be on the right.
Views 1-2: June 15, 1933
View 3: August 24,1938
P. L. Sperr

732060f-b.title: Islands - Governors Island - Castle William.
732060f-b.text:
(1) The circular fortress, Castle William, now used as a military prison; at the northern end of Governor's Island.
July 7, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a closer view at an earlier date. Viewed from a different angle.
May 4, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as view 2. In the background is visible the Brooklyn skyline.
February 10, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

732067f.title: Islands - Governors Island.
732067f.text:
Governors Island: New York's famed skyline contrasted against
antiquated cannons.
1938-9
Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. y.' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
